00032 /*
00033  * lustre/osp/osp_object.c
00034  *
00035  * Lustre OST Proxy Device (OSP) is the agent on the local MDT for the OST
00036  * or remote MDT.
00037  *
00038  * OSP object attributes cache
00039  * ---------------------------
00040  * OSP object is the stub of the remote OST-object or MDT-object. Both the
00041  * attribute and the extended attributes are stored on the peer side remotely.
00042  * It is inefficient to send RPC to peer to fetch those attributes when every
00043  * get_attr()/get_xattr() called. For a large system, the LFSCK synchronous
00044  * mode scanning is prohibitively inefficient.
00045  *
00046  * So the OSP maintains the OSP object attributes cache to cache some
00047  * attributes on the local MDT. The cache is organized against the OSP
00048  * object as follows:
00049  *
00050  * struct osp_xattr_entry {
00051  *      struct list_head         oxe_list;
00052  *      atomic_t                 oxe_ref;
00053  *      void                    *oxe_value;
00054  *      int                      oxe_buflen;
00055  *      int                      oxe_namelen;
00056  *      int                      oxe_vallen;
00057  *      unsigned int             oxe_exist:1,
00058  *                               oxe_ready:1;
00059  *      char                     oxe_buf[0];
00060  * };
00061  *
00062  * struct osp_object_attr {
00063  *      struct lu_attr          ooa_attr;
00064  *      struct list_head        ooa_xattr_list;
00065  * };
00066  *
00067  * struct osp_object {
00068  *      ...
00069  *      struct osp_object_attr *opo_ooa;
00070  *      spinlock_t              opo_lock;
00071  *      ...
00072  * };
00073  *
00074  * The basic attributes, such as owner/mode/flags, are stored in the
00075  * osp_object_attr::ooa_attr. The extended attributes will be stored
00076  * as osp_xattr_entry. Every extended attribute has an independent
00077  * osp_xattr_entry, and all the osp_xattr_entry are linked into the
00078  * osp_object_attr::ooa_xattr_list. The OSP object attributes cache
00079  * is protected by the osp_object::opo_lock.
00080  *
00081  * Not all OSP objects have an attributes cache because maintaining
00082  * the cache requires some resources. Currently, the OSP object
00083  * attributes cache will be initialized when the attributes or the
00084  * extended attributes are pre-fetched via osp_declare_attr_get()
00085  * or osp_declare_xattr_get(). That is usually for LFSCK purpose,
00086  * but it also can be shared by others.
00087  *
00088  *
00089  * XXX: NOT prepare out RPC for remote transaction. ((please refer to the
00090  *      comment of osp_trans_create() for remote transaction)
00091  *
00092  * According to our current transaction/dt_object_lock framework (to make
00093  * the cross-MDTs modification for DNE1 to be workable), the transaction
00094  * sponsor will start the transaction firstly, then try to acquire related
00095  * dt_object_lock if needed. Under such rules, if we want to prepare the
00096  * OUT RPC in the transaction declare phase, then related attr/xattr
00097  * should be known without dt_object_lock. But such condition maybe not
00098  * true for some remote transaction case. For example:
00099  *
00100  * For linkEA repairing (by LFSCK) case, before the LFSCK thread obtained
00101  * the dt_object_lock on the target MDT-object, it cannot know whether
00102  * the MDT-object has linkEA or not, neither invalid or not.
00103  *
00104  * Since the LFSCK thread cannot hold dt_object_lock before the remote
00105  * transaction start (otherwise there will be some potential deadlock),
00106  * it cannot prepare related OUT RPC for repairing during the declare
00107  * phase as other normal transactions do.
00108  *
00109  * To resolve the trouble, we will make OSP to prepare related OUT RPC
00110  * after remote transaction started, and trigger the remote updating
00111  * (send RPC) when trans_stop. Then the up layer users, such as LFSCK,
00112  * can follow the general rule to handle trans_start/dt_object_lock
00113  * for repairing linkEA inconsistency without distinguishing remote
00114  * MDT-object.
00115  *
00116  * In fact, above solution for remote transaction should be the normal
00117  * model without considering DNE1. The trouble brought by DNE1 will be
00118  * resolved in DNE2. At that time, this patch can be removed.
00119  *
00120  *
00121  * Author: Alex Zhuravlev <alexey.zhuravlev@intel.com>
00122  * Author: Mikhail Pershin <mike.tappro@intel.com>
00123  */
00124

00132 static inline __u32 osp_dev2node(struct osp_device *osp)
00133 {
00134         return osp->opd_storage->dd_lu_dev.ld_site->ld_seq_site->ss_node_id;
00135 }

00137 static inline bool is_ost_obj(struct lu_object *lo)
00138 {
00139         return !lu2osp_dev(lo->lo_dev)->opd_connect_mdt;
00140 }

00152 static void osp_object_assign_fid(const struct lu_env *env,
00153                                   struct osp_device *d, struct osp_object *o)
00154 {
00155         struct osp_thread_info *osi = osp_env_info(env);
00156 
00157         LASSERT(fid_is_zero(lu_object_fid(&o->opo_obj.do_lu)));
00158         LASSERT(o->opo_reserved);
00159         o->opo_reserved = 0;
00160 
00161         osp_precreate_get_fid(env, d, &osi->osi_fid);
00162 
00163         lu_object_assign_fid(env, &o->opo_obj.do_lu, &osi->osi_fid);
00164 }
00165 
00174 int osp_oac_init(struct osp_object *obj)
00175 {
00176         struct osp_object_attr *ooa;
00177 
00178         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(ooa);
00179         if (ooa == NULL)
00180                 return -ENOMEM;
00181 
00182         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ooa->ooa_xattr_list);
00183         spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
00184         if (likely(obj->opo_ooa == NULL)) {
00185                 obj->opo_ooa = ooa;
00186                 spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00187         } else {
00188                 spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00189                 OBD_FREE_PTR(ooa);
00190         }
00191 
00192         return 0;
00193 }
00194 
00209 static struct osp_xattr_entry *
00210 osp_oac_xattr_find_locked(struct osp_object_attr *ooa,
00211                           const char *name, size_t namelen)
00212 {
00213         struct osp_xattr_entry *oxe;
00214 
00215         list_for_each_entry(oxe, &ooa->ooa_xattr_list, oxe_list) {
00216                 if (namelen == oxe->oxe_namelen &&
00217                     strncmp(name, oxe->oxe_buf, namelen) == 0)
00218                         return oxe;
00219         }
00220 
00221         return NULL;
00222 }
00223 
00238 static struct osp_xattr_entry *osp_oac_xattr_find(struct osp_object *obj,
00239                                                   const char *name, bool unlink)
00240 {
00241         struct osp_xattr_entry *oxe = NULL;
00242 
00243         spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
00244         if (obj->opo_ooa != NULL) {
00245                 oxe = osp_oac_xattr_find_locked(obj->opo_ooa, name,
00246                                                 strlen(name));
00247                 if (oxe != NULL) {
00248                         if (unlink)
00249                                 list_del_init(&oxe->oxe_list);
00250                         else
00251                                 atomic_inc(&oxe->oxe_ref);
00252                 }
00253         }
00254         spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00255 
00256         return oxe;
00257 }
00258 
00274 static struct osp_xattr_entry *
00275 osp_oac_xattr_find_or_add(struct osp_object *obj, const char *name, size_t len)
00276 {
00277         struct osp_object_attr *ooa     = obj->opo_ooa;
00278         struct osp_xattr_entry *oxe;
00279         struct osp_xattr_entry *tmp     = NULL;
00280         size_t                  namelen = strlen(name);
00281         size_t                  size    = sizeof(*oxe) + namelen + 1 + len;
00282 
00283         LASSERT(ooa != NULL);
00284 
00285         oxe = osp_oac_xattr_find(obj, name, false);
00286         if (oxe != NULL)
00287                 return oxe;
00288 
00289         OBD_ALLOC(oxe, size);
00290         if (unlikely(oxe == NULL))
00291                 return NULL;
00292 
00293         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&oxe->oxe_list);
00294         oxe->oxe_buflen = size;
00295         oxe->oxe_namelen = namelen;
00296         memcpy(oxe->oxe_buf, name, namelen);
00297         oxe->oxe_value = oxe->oxe_buf + namelen + 1;
00298         /* One ref is for the caller, the other is for the entry on the list. */
00299         atomic_set(&oxe->oxe_ref, 2);
00300 
00301         spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
00302         tmp = osp_oac_xattr_find_locked(ooa, name, namelen);
00303         if (tmp == NULL)
00304                 list_add_tail(&oxe->oxe_list, &ooa->ooa_xattr_list);
00305         else
00306                 atomic_inc(&tmp->oxe_ref);
00307         spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00308 
00309         if (tmp != NULL) {
00310                 OBD_FREE(oxe, size);
00311                 oxe = tmp;
00312         }
00313 
00314         return oxe;
00315 }
00316 
00334 static struct osp_xattr_entry *
00335 osp_oac_xattr_replace(struct osp_object *obj,
00336                       struct osp_xattr_entry **poxe, size_t len)
00337 {
00338         struct osp_object_attr *ooa     = obj->opo_ooa;
00339         struct osp_xattr_entry *oxe;
00340         size_t                  namelen = (*poxe)->oxe_namelen;
00341         size_t                  size    = sizeof(*oxe) + namelen + 1 + len;
00342 
00343         LASSERT(ooa != NULL);
00344 
00345         OBD_ALLOC(oxe, size);
00346         if (unlikely(oxe == NULL))
00347                 return NULL;
00348 
00349         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&oxe->oxe_list);
00350         oxe->oxe_buflen = size;
00351         oxe->oxe_namelen = namelen;
00352         memcpy(oxe->oxe_buf, (*poxe)->oxe_buf, namelen);
00353         oxe->oxe_value = oxe->oxe_buf + namelen + 1;
00354         /* One ref is for the caller, the other is for the entry on the list. */
00355         atomic_set(&oxe->oxe_ref, 2);
00356 
00357         spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
00358         *poxe = osp_oac_xattr_find_locked(ooa, oxe->oxe_buf, namelen);
00359         LASSERT(*poxe != NULL);
00360 
00361         list_del_init(&(*poxe)->oxe_list);
00362         list_add_tail(&oxe->oxe_list, &ooa->ooa_xattr_list);
00363         spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00364 
00365         return oxe;
00366 }
00367 
00375 static inline void osp_oac_xattr_put(struct osp_xattr_entry *oxe)
00376 {
00377         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&oxe->oxe_ref)) {
00378                 LASSERT(list_empty(&oxe->oxe_list));
00379 
00380                 OBD_FREE(oxe, oxe->oxe_buflen);
00381         }
00382 }
00383 
00400 static int osp_get_attr_from_reply(const struct lu_env *env,
00401                                    struct object_update_reply *reply,
00402                                    struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00403                                    struct lu_attr *attr,
00404                                    struct osp_object *obj, int index)
00405 {
00406         struct osp_thread_info  *osi    = osp_env_info(env);
00407         struct lu_buf           *rbuf   = &osi->osi_lb2;
00408         struct obdo             *lobdo  = &osi->osi_obdo;
00409         struct obdo             *wobdo;
00410         int                     rc;
00411 
00412         rc = object_update_result_data_get(reply, rbuf, index);
00413         if (rc < 0)
00414                 return rc;
00415 
00416         wobdo = rbuf->lb_buf;
00417         if (rbuf->lb_len != sizeof(*wobdo))
00418                 return -EPROTO;
00419 
00420         LASSERT(req != NULL);
00421         if (ptlrpc_req_need_swab(req))
00422                 lustre_swab_obdo(wobdo);
00423 
00424         lustre_get_wire_obdo(NULL, lobdo, wobdo);
00425         spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
00426         if (obj->opo_ooa != NULL) {
00427                 la_from_obdo(&obj->opo_ooa->ooa_attr, lobdo, lobdo->o_valid);
00428                 if (attr != NULL)
00429                         *attr = obj->opo_ooa->ooa_attr;
00430         } else {
00431                 LASSERT(attr != NULL);
00432 
00433                 la_from_obdo(attr, lobdo, lobdo->o_valid);
00434         }
00435         spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00436 
00437         return 0;
00438 }
00439 
00457 static int osp_attr_get_interpterer(const struct lu_env *env,
00458                                     struct object_update_reply *reply,
00459                                     struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00460                                     struct osp_object *obj,
00461                                     void *data, int index, int rc)
00462 {
00463         struct lu_attr *attr = data;
00464 
00465         LASSERT(obj->opo_ooa != NULL);
00466 
00467         if (rc == 0) {
00468                 osp2lu_obj(obj)->lo_header->loh_attr |= LOHA_EXISTS;
00469                 obj->opo_non_exist = 0;
00470 
00471                 return osp_get_attr_from_reply(env, reply, req, NULL, obj,
00472                                                index);
00473         } else {
00474                 if (rc == -ENOENT) {
00475                         osp2lu_obj(obj)->lo_header->loh_attr &= ~LOHA_EXISTS;
00476                         obj->opo_non_exist = 1;
00477                 }
00478 
00479                 spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
00480                 attr->la_valid = 0;
00481                 spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00482         }
00483 
00484         return 0;
00485 }
00486 
00503 static int osp_declare_attr_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt)
00504 {
00505         struct osp_object       *obj    = dt2osp_obj(dt);
00506         struct osp_device       *osp    = lu2osp_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
00507         int                      rc     = 0;
00508 
00509         if (obj->opo_ooa == NULL) {
00510                 rc = osp_oac_init(obj);
00511                 if (rc != 0)
00512                         return rc;
00513         }
00514 
00515         mutex_lock(&osp->opd_async_requests_mutex);
00516         rc = osp_insert_async_request(env, OUT_ATTR_GET, obj, 0, NULL, NULL,
00517                                       &obj->opo_ooa->ooa_attr,
00518                                       sizeof(struct obdo),
00519                                       osp_attr_get_interpterer);
00520         mutex_unlock(&osp->opd_async_requests_mutex);
00521 
00522         return rc;
00523 }
00524 
00542 int osp_attr_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00543                  struct lu_attr *attr)
00544 {
00545         struct osp_device               *osp = lu2osp_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
00546         struct osp_object               *obj = dt2osp_obj(dt);
00547         struct dt_device                *dev = &osp->opd_dt_dev;
00548         struct osp_update_request       *update;
00549         struct object_update_reply      *reply;
00550         struct ptlrpc_request           *req = NULL;
00551         int                             rc = 0;
00552         ENTRY;
00553 
00554         if (is_ost_obj(&dt->do_lu) && obj->opo_non_exist)
00555                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00556 
00557         if (obj->opo_ooa != NULL) {
00558                 spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
00559                 if (obj->opo_ooa->ooa_attr.la_valid != 0 && !obj->opo_stale) {
00560                         *attr = obj->opo_ooa->ooa_attr;
00561                         spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00562 
00563                         RETURN(0);
00564                 }
00565                 spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00566         }
00567 
00568         update = osp_update_request_create(dev);
00569         if (IS_ERR(update))
00570                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(update));
00571 
00572         rc = osp_update_rpc_pack(env, attr_get, update, OUT_ATTR_GET,
00573                                  lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu));
00574         if (rc != 0) {
00575                 CERROR("%s: Insert update error "DFID": rc = %d\n",
00576                        dev->dd_lu_dev.ld_obd->obd_name,
00577                        PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)), rc);
00578 
00579                 GOTO(out, rc);
00580         }
00581 
00582         rc = osp_remote_sync(env, osp, update, &req);
00583         if (rc != 0) {
00584                 if (rc == -ENOENT) {
00585                         osp2lu_obj(obj)->lo_header->loh_attr &= ~LOHA_EXISTS;
00586                         obj->opo_non_exist = 1;
00587                 } else {
00588                         CERROR("%s:osp_attr_get update error "DFID": rc = %d\n",
00589                                dev->dd_lu_dev.ld_obd->obd_name,
00590                                PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)), rc);
00591                 }
00592 
00593                 GOTO(out, rc);
00594         }
00595 
00596         osp2lu_obj(obj)->lo_header->loh_attr |= LOHA_EXISTS;
00597         obj->opo_non_exist = 0;
00598         reply = req_capsule_server_sized_get(&req->rq_pill,
00599                                              &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_REPLY,
00600                                              OUT_UPDATE_REPLY_SIZE);
00601         if (reply == NULL || reply->ourp_magic != UPDATE_REPLY_MAGIC)
00602                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00603 
00604         rc = osp_get_attr_from_reply(env, reply, req, attr, obj, 0);
00605         if (rc != 0)
00606                 GOTO(out, rc);
00607 
00608         spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
00609         if (obj->opo_stale)
00610                 obj->opo_stale = 0;
00611         spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00612 
00613         GOTO(out, rc);
00614 
00615 out:
00616         if (req != NULL)
00617                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00618 
00619         osp_update_request_destroy(update);
00620 
00621         return rc;
00622 }
00623 
00638 static int osp_declare_attr_set(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00639                                 const struct lu_attr *attr, struct thandle *th)
00640 {
00641         struct osp_device       *d = lu2osp_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
00642         struct osp_object       *o = dt2osp_obj(dt);
00643         int                     rc;
00644 
00645         if (is_only_remote_trans(th))
00646                 return osp_md_declare_attr_set(env, dt, attr, th);
00647         /*
00648          * Usually we don't allow server stack to manipulate size
00649          * but there is a special case when striping is created
00650          * late, after stripeless file got truncated to non-zero.
00651          *
00652          * In this case we do the following:
00653          *
00654          * 1) grab id in declare - this can lead to leaked OST objects
00655          *    but we don't currently have proper mechanism and the only
00656          *    options we have are to do truncate RPC holding transaction
00657          *    open (very bad) or to grab id in declare at cost of leaked
00658          *    OST object in same very rare unfortunate case (just bad)
00659          *    notice 1.6-2.0 do assignment outside of running transaction
00660          *    all the time, meaning many more chances for leaked objects.
00661          *
00662          * 2) send synchronous truncate RPC with just assigned id
00663          */
00664 
00665         /* there are few places in MDD code still passing NULL
00666          * XXX: to be fixed soon */
00667         if (attr == NULL)
00668                 RETURN(0);
00669 
00670         if (attr->la_valid & LA_SIZE && attr->la_size > 0 &&
00671             fid_is_zero(lu_object_fid(&o->opo_obj.do_lu))) {
00672                 LASSERT(!dt_object_exists(dt));
00673                 osp_object_assign_fid(env, d, o);
00674                 rc = osp_object_truncate(env, dt, attr->la_size);
00675                 if (rc != 0)
00676                         RETURN(rc);
00677         }
00678 
00679         if (!(attr->la_valid & (LA_UID | LA_GID)))
00680                 RETURN(0);
00681 
00682         /* track all UID/GID changes via llog */
00683         rc = osp_sync_declare_add(env, o, MDS_SETATTR64_REC, th);
00684 
00685         return 0;
00686 }
00687 
00709 static int osp_attr_set(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00710                         const struct lu_attr *attr, struct thandle *th)
00711 {
00712         struct osp_object       *o = dt2osp_obj(dt);
00713         int                      rc = 0;
00714         ENTRY;
00715 
00716         /* we're interested in uid/gid changes only */
00717         if (!(attr->la_valid & (LA_UID | LA_GID)))
00718                 RETURN(0);
00719 
00720         if (!is_only_remote_trans(th)) {
00721                 rc = osp_sync_add(env, o, MDS_SETATTR64_REC, th, attr);
00722                 /* XXX: send new uid/gid to OST ASAP? */
00723         } else {
00724                 struct lu_attr  *la;
00725 
00726                 /* It is for OST-object attr_set directly without updating
00727                  * local MDT-object attribute. It is usually used by LFSCK. */
00728                 rc = osp_md_attr_set(env, dt, attr, th);
00729                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "(1) set attr "DFID": rc = %d\n",
00730                        PFID(&dt->do_lu.lo_header->loh_fid), rc);
00731 
00732                 if (rc != 0 || o->opo_ooa == NULL)
00733                         RETURN(rc);
00734 
00735                 /* Update the OSP object attributes cache. */
00736                 la = &o->opo_ooa->ooa_attr;
00737                 spin_lock(&o->opo_lock);
00738                 if (attr->la_valid & LA_UID) {
00739                         la->la_uid = attr->la_uid;
00740                         la->la_valid |= LA_UID;
00741                 }
00742 
00743                 if (attr->la_valid & LA_GID) {
00744                         la->la_gid = attr->la_gid;
00745                         la->la_valid |= LA_GID;
00746                 }
00747                 spin_unlock(&o->opo_lock);
00748         }
00749 
00750         RETURN(rc);
00751 }
00752 
00770 static int osp_xattr_get_interpterer(const struct lu_env *env,
00771                                      struct object_update_reply *reply,
00772                                      struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00773                                      struct osp_object *obj,
00774                                      void *data, int index, int rc)
00775 {
00776         struct osp_object_attr  *ooa  = obj->opo_ooa;
00777         struct osp_xattr_entry  *oxe  = data;
00778         struct lu_buf           *rbuf = &osp_env_info(env)->osi_lb2;
00779 
00780         LASSERT(ooa != NULL);
00781 
00782         if (rc == 0) {
00783                 size_t len = sizeof(*oxe) + oxe->oxe_namelen + 1;
00784 
00785                 rc = object_update_result_data_get(reply, rbuf, index);
00786                 if (rc < 0 || rbuf->lb_len > (oxe->oxe_buflen - len)) {
00787                         spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
00788                         oxe->oxe_ready = 0;
00789                         spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00790                         osp_oac_xattr_put(oxe);
00791 
00792                         return rc < 0 ? rc : -ERANGE;
00793                 }
00794 
00795                 spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
00796                 oxe->oxe_vallen = rbuf->lb_len;
00797                 memcpy(oxe->oxe_value, rbuf->lb_buf, rbuf->lb_len);
00798                 oxe->oxe_exist = 1;
00799                 oxe->oxe_ready = 1;
00800                 spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00801         } else if (rc == -ENOENT || rc == -ENODATA) {
00802                 spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
00803                 oxe->oxe_exist = 0;
00804                 oxe->oxe_ready = 1;
00805                 spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00806         } else {
00807                 spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
00808                 oxe->oxe_ready = 0;
00809                 spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00810         }
00811 
00812         osp_oac_xattr_put(oxe);
00813 
00814         return 0;
00815 }
00816 
00835 static int osp_declare_xattr_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00836                                  struct lu_buf *buf, const char *name)
00837 {
00838         struct osp_object       *obj     = dt2osp_obj(dt);
00839         struct osp_device       *osp     = lu2osp_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
00840         struct osp_xattr_entry  *oxe;
00841         __u16                    namelen = strlen(name);
00842         int                      rc      = 0;
00843 
00844         LASSERT(buf != NULL);
00845         LASSERT(name != NULL);
00846 
00847         /* If only for xattr size, return directly. */
00848         if (unlikely(buf->lb_len == 0))
00849                 return 0;
00850 
00851         if (obj->opo_ooa == NULL) {
00852                 rc = osp_oac_init(obj);
00853                 if (rc != 0)
00854                         return rc;
00855         }
00856 
00857         oxe = osp_oac_xattr_find_or_add(obj, name, buf->lb_len);
00858         if (oxe == NULL)
00859                 return -ENOMEM;
00860 
00861         mutex_lock(&osp->opd_async_requests_mutex);
00862         rc = osp_insert_async_request(env, OUT_XATTR_GET, obj, 1,
00863                                       &namelen, (const void **)&name,
00864                                       oxe, buf->lb_len,
00865                                       osp_xattr_get_interpterer);
00866         if (rc != 0) {
00867                 mutex_unlock(&osp->opd_async_requests_mutex);
00868                 osp_oac_xattr_put(oxe);
00869         } else {
00870                 struct osp_update_request *our;
00871                 struct osp_update_request_sub *ours;
00872 
00873                 /* XXX: Currently, we trigger the batched async OUT
00874                  *      RPC via dt_declare_xattr_get(). It is not
00875                  *      perfect solution, but works well now.
00876                  *
00877                  *      We will improve it in the future. */
00878                 our = osp->opd_async_requests;
00879                 ours = osp_current_object_update_request(our);
00880                 if (ours != NULL && ours->ours_req != NULL &&
00881                     ours->ours_req->ourq_count > 0) {
00882                         osp->opd_async_requests = NULL;
00883                         mutex_unlock(&osp->opd_async_requests_mutex);
00884                         rc = osp_unplug_async_request(env, osp, our);
00885                 } else {
00886                         mutex_unlock(&osp->opd_async_requests_mutex);
00887                 }
00888         }
00889 
00890         return rc;
00891 }
00892 
00916 int osp_xattr_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00917                   struct lu_buf *buf, const char *name)
00918 {
00919         struct osp_device       *osp    = lu2osp_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
00920         struct osp_object       *obj    = dt2osp_obj(dt);
00921         struct dt_device        *dev    = &osp->opd_dt_dev;
00922         struct lu_buf           *rbuf   = &osp_env_info(env)->osi_lb2;
00923         struct osp_update_request *update = NULL;
00924         struct ptlrpc_request   *req    = NULL;
00925         struct object_update_reply *reply;
00926         struct osp_xattr_entry  *oxe    = NULL;
00927         const char              *dname  = dt->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name;
00928         int                      rc     = 0;
00929         ENTRY;
00930 
00931         LASSERT(buf != NULL);
00932         LASSERT(name != NULL);
00933 
00934         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LFSCK_BAD_NETWORK) &&
00935             osp->opd_index == cfs_fail_val) {
00936                 if (is_ost_obj(&dt->do_lu)) {
00937                         if (osp_dev2node(osp) == cfs_fail_val)
00938                                 RETURN(-ENOTCONN);
00939                 } else {
00940                         if (strcmp(name, XATTR_NAME_LINK) == 0)
00941                                 RETURN(-ENOTCONN);
00942                 }
00943         }
00944 
00945         if (unlikely(obj->opo_non_exist))
00946                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00947 
00948         /* Only cache xattr for OST object */
00949         if (!osp->opd_connect_mdt) {
00950                 oxe = osp_oac_xattr_find(obj, name, false);
00951                 if (oxe != NULL) {
00952                         spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
00953                         if (oxe->oxe_ready) {
00954                                 if (!oxe->oxe_exist)
00955                                         GOTO(unlock, rc = -ENODATA);
00956 
00957                                 if (buf->lb_buf == NULL)
00958                                         GOTO(unlock, rc = oxe->oxe_vallen);
00959 
00960                                 if (buf->lb_len < oxe->oxe_vallen)
00961                                         GOTO(unlock, rc = -ERANGE);
00962 
00963                                 memcpy(buf->lb_buf, oxe->oxe_value,
00964                                        oxe->oxe_vallen);
00965 
00966                                 GOTO(unlock, rc = oxe->oxe_vallen);
00967 
00968 unlock:
00969                                 spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00970                                 osp_oac_xattr_put(oxe);
00971 
00972                                 return rc;
00973                         }
00974                         spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
00975                 }
00976         }
00977         update = osp_update_request_create(dev);
00978         if (IS_ERR(update))
00979                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(update));
00980 
00981         rc = osp_update_rpc_pack(env, xattr_get, update, OUT_XATTR_GET,
00982                                  lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu), name, buf->lb_len);
00983         if (rc != 0) {
00984                 CERROR("%s: Insert update error "DFID": rc = %d\n",
00985                        dname, PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)), rc);
00986                 GOTO(out, rc);
00987         }
00988 
00989         rc = osp_remote_sync(env, osp, update, &req);
00990         if (rc < 0) {
00991                 if (rc == -ENOENT) {
00992                         dt->do_lu.lo_header->loh_attr &= ~LOHA_EXISTS;
00993                         obj->opo_non_exist = 1;
00994                 }
00995 
00996                 if (obj->opo_ooa == NULL)
00997                         GOTO(out, rc);
00998 
00999                 if (oxe == NULL)
01000                         oxe = osp_oac_xattr_find_or_add(obj, name, buf->lb_len);
01001 
01002                 if (oxe == NULL) {
01003                         CWARN("%s: Fail to add xattr (%s) to cache for "
01004                               DFID" (1): rc = %d\n", dname, name,
01005                               PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)), rc);
01006 
01007                         GOTO(out, rc);
01008                 }
01009 
01010                 spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
01011                 if (rc == -ENOENT || rc == -ENODATA) {
01012                         oxe->oxe_exist = 0;
01013                         oxe->oxe_ready = 1;
01014                 } else {
01015                         oxe->oxe_ready = 0;
01016                 }
01017                 spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
01018 
01019                 GOTO(out, rc);
01020         }
01021 
01022         reply = req_capsule_server_sized_get(&req->rq_pill,
01023                                              &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_REPLY,
01024                                              OUT_UPDATE_REPLY_SIZE);
01025         if (reply->ourp_magic != UPDATE_REPLY_MAGIC) {
01026                 CERROR("%s: Wrong version %x expected %x "DFID": rc = %d\n",
01027                        dname, reply->ourp_magic, UPDATE_REPLY_MAGIC,
01028                        PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)), -EPROTO);
01029 
01030                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01031         }
01032 
01033         rc = object_update_result_data_get(reply, rbuf, 0);
01034         if (rc < 0)
01035                 GOTO(out, rc);
01036 
01037         if (buf->lb_buf == NULL)
01038                 GOTO(out, rc);
01039 
01040         if (unlikely(buf->lb_len < rbuf->lb_len))
01041                 GOTO(out, rc = -ERANGE);
01042 
01043         memcpy(buf->lb_buf, rbuf->lb_buf, rbuf->lb_len);
01044         if (obj->opo_ooa == NULL || osp->opd_connect_mdt)
01045                 GOTO(out, rc);
01046 
01047         if (oxe == NULL) {
01048                 oxe = osp_oac_xattr_find_or_add(obj, name, rbuf->lb_len);
01049                 if (oxe == NULL) {
01050                         CWARN("%s: Fail to add xattr (%s) to "
01051                               "cache for "DFID" (2): rc = %d\n",
01052                               dname, name, PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)), rc);
01053 
01054                         GOTO(out, rc);
01055                 }
01056         }
01057 
01058         if (oxe->oxe_buflen - oxe->oxe_namelen - 1 < rbuf->lb_len) {
01059                 struct osp_xattr_entry *old = oxe;
01060                 struct osp_xattr_entry *tmp;
01061 
01062                 tmp = osp_oac_xattr_replace(obj, &old, rbuf->lb_len);
01063                 osp_oac_xattr_put(oxe);
01064                 oxe = tmp;
01065                 if (tmp == NULL) {
01066                         CWARN("%s: Fail to update xattr (%s) to "
01067                               "cache for "DFID": rc = %d\n",
01068                               dname, name, PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)), rc);
01069                         spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
01070                         old->oxe_ready = 0;
01071                         spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
01072 
01073                         GOTO(out, rc);
01074                 }
01075 
01076                 /* Drop the ref for entry on list. */
01077                 osp_oac_xattr_put(old);
01078         }
01079 
01080         spin_lock(&obj->opo_lock);
01081         oxe->oxe_vallen = rbuf->lb_len;
01082         memcpy(oxe->oxe_value, rbuf->lb_buf, rbuf->lb_len);
01083         oxe->oxe_exist = 1;
01084         oxe->oxe_ready = 1;
01085         spin_unlock(&obj->opo_lock);
01086 
01087         GOTO(out, rc);
01088 
01089 out:
01090         if (req != NULL)
01091                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01092 
01093         if (update != NULL && !IS_ERR(update))
01094                 osp_update_request_destroy(update);
01095 
01096         if (oxe != NULL)
01097                 osp_oac_xattr_put(oxe);
01098 
01099         return rc;
01100 }
01101 
01125 int osp_declare_xattr_set(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01126                           const struct lu_buf *buf, const char *name,
01127                           int flag, struct thandle *th)
01128 {
01129         return osp_trans_update_request_create(th);
01130 }
01131 
01153 int osp_xattr_set(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01154                   const struct lu_buf *buf, const char *name, int fl,
01155                   struct thandle *th)
01156 {
01157         struct osp_object       *o = dt2osp_obj(dt);
01158         struct osp_device       *osp = lu2osp_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
01159         struct osp_update_request *update;
01160         struct osp_xattr_entry  *oxe;
01161         int                     rc;
01162         ENTRY;
01163 
01164         update = thandle_to_osp_update_request(th);
01165         LASSERT(update != NULL);
01166 
01167         CDEBUG(D_INODE, DFID" set xattr '%s' with size %zd\n",
01168                PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)), name, buf->lb_len);
01169 
01170         rc = osp_update_rpc_pack(env, xattr_set, update, OUT_XATTR_SET,
01171                                  lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu), buf, name, fl);
01172         if (rc != 0 || o->opo_ooa == NULL || osp->opd_connect_mdt)
01173                 RETURN(rc);
01174 
01175         oxe = osp_oac_xattr_find_or_add(o, name, buf->lb_len);
01176         if (oxe == NULL) {
01177                 CWARN("%s: cannot cache xattr '%s' of "DFID"\n",
01178                       dt->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
01179                       name, PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)));
01180 
01181                 RETURN(0);
01182         }
01183 
01184         if (oxe->oxe_buflen - oxe->oxe_namelen - 1 < buf->lb_len) {
01185                 struct osp_xattr_entry *old = oxe;
01186                 struct osp_xattr_entry *tmp;
01187 
01188                 tmp = osp_oac_xattr_replace(o, &old, buf->lb_len);
01189                 osp_oac_xattr_put(oxe);
01190                 oxe = tmp;
01191                 if (tmp == NULL) {
01192                         CWARN("%s: cannot update cached xattr '%s' of "DFID"\n",
01193                               dt->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
01194                               name, PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)));
01195                         spin_lock(&o->opo_lock);
01196                         old->oxe_ready = 0;
01197                         spin_unlock(&o->opo_lock);
01198 
01199                         RETURN(0);
01200                 }
01201 
01202                 /* Drop the ref for entry on list. */
01203                 osp_oac_xattr_put(old);
01204         }
01205 
01206         spin_lock(&o->opo_lock);
01207         oxe->oxe_vallen = buf->lb_len;
01208         memcpy(oxe->oxe_value, buf->lb_buf, buf->lb_len);
01209         oxe->oxe_exist = 1;
01210         oxe->oxe_ready = 1;
01211         spin_unlock(&o->opo_lock);
01212         osp_oac_xattr_put(oxe);
01213 
01214         RETURN(0);
01215 }
01216 
01236 int osp_declare_xattr_del(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01237                           const char *name, struct thandle *th)
01238 {
01239         return osp_trans_update_request_create(th);
01240 }
01241 
01260 int osp_xattr_del(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01261                   const char *name, struct thandle *th)
01262 {
01263         struct osp_update_request *update;
01264         const struct lu_fid      *fid = lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu);
01265         struct osp_object        *o     = dt2osp_obj(dt);
01266         struct osp_xattr_entry   *oxe;
01267         int                       rc;
01268 
01269         update = thandle_to_osp_update_request(th);
01270         LASSERT(update != NULL);
01271 
01272         rc = osp_update_rpc_pack(env, xattr_del, update, OUT_XATTR_DEL,
01273                                  fid, name);
01274         if (rc != 0 || o->opo_ooa == NULL)
01275                 return rc;
01276 
01277         oxe = osp_oac_xattr_find(o, name, true);
01278         if (oxe != NULL)
01279                 /* Drop the ref for entry on list. */
01280                 osp_oac_xattr_put(oxe);
01281 
01282         return 0;
01283 }
01284 
01309 static int osp_declare_object_create(const struct lu_env *env,
01310                                      struct dt_object *dt,
01311                                      struct lu_attr *attr,
01312                                      struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
01313                                      struct dt_object_format *dof,
01314                                      struct thandle *th)
01315 {
01316         struct osp_thread_info  *osi = osp_env_info(env);
01317         struct osp_device       *d = lu2osp_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
01318         struct osp_object       *o = dt2osp_obj(dt);
01319         const struct lu_fid     *fid = lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu);
01320         struct thandle          *local_th;
01321         int                      rc = 0;
01322 
01323         ENTRY;
01324 
01325         if (is_only_remote_trans(th) && !fid_is_zero(fid)) {
01326                 LASSERT(fid_is_sane(fid));
01327 
01328                 rc = osp_md_declare_object_create(env, dt, attr, hint, dof, th);
01329 
01330                 RETURN(rc);
01331         }
01332 
01333         /* should happen to non-0 OSP only so that at least one object
01334          * has been already declared in the scenario and LOD should
01335          * cleanup that */
01336         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDS_OSC_CREATE_FAIL) && d->opd_index == 1)
01337                 RETURN(-ENOSPC);
01338 
01339         LASSERT(d->opd_last_used_oid_file);
01340 
01341         /*
01342          * There can be gaps in precreated ids and record to unlink llog
01343          * XXX: we do not handle gaps yet, implemented before solution
01344          *      was found to be racy, so we disabled that. there is no
01345          *      point in making useless but expensive llog declaration.
01346          */
01347         /* rc = osp_sync_declare_add(env, o, MDS_UNLINK64_REC, th); */
01348 
01349         local_th = osp_get_storage_thandle(env, th, d);
01350         if (IS_ERR(local_th))
01351                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(local_th));
01352 
01353         if (unlikely(!fid_is_zero(fid))) {
01354                 /* replay case: caller knows fid */
01355                 osi->osi_off = sizeof(osi->osi_id) * d->opd_index;
01356                 osi->osi_lb.lb_len = sizeof(osi->osi_id);
01357                 osi->osi_lb.lb_buf = NULL;
01358 
01359                 rc = dt_declare_record_write(env, d->opd_last_used_oid_file,
01360                                              &osi->osi_lb, osi->osi_off,
01361                                              local_th);
01362                 RETURN(rc);
01363         }
01364 
01365         /*
01366          * in declaration we need to reserve object so that we don't block
01367          * awaiting precreation RPC to complete
01368          */
01369         rc = osp_precreate_reserve(env, d);
01370         /*
01371          * we also need to declare update to local "last used id" file for
01372          * recovery if object isn't used for a reason, we need to release
01373          * reservation, this can be made in osd_object_release()
01374          */
01375         if (rc == 0) {
01376                 /* mark id is reserved: in create we don't want to talk
01377                  * to OST */
01378                 LASSERT(o->opo_reserved == 0);
01379                 o->opo_reserved = 1;
01380 
01381                 /* common for all OSPs file hystorically */
01382                 osi->osi_off = sizeof(osi->osi_id) * d->opd_index;
01383                 osi->osi_lb.lb_len = sizeof(osi->osi_id);
01384                 osi->osi_lb.lb_buf = NULL;
01385                 rc = dt_declare_record_write(env, d->opd_last_used_oid_file,
01386                                              &osi->osi_lb, osi->osi_off,
01387                                              local_th);
01388         } else {
01389                 /* not needed in the cache anymore */
01390                 set_bit(LU_OBJECT_HEARD_BANSHEE,
01391                             &dt->do_lu.lo_header->loh_flags);
01392         }
01393         RETURN(rc);
01394 }
01395 
01417 static int osp_object_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01418                              struct lu_attr *attr,
01419                              struct dt_allocation_hint *hint,
01420                              struct dt_object_format *dof, struct thandle *th)
01421 {
01422         struct osp_thread_info  *osi = osp_env_info(env);
01423         struct osp_device       *d = lu2osp_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
01424         struct osp_object       *o = dt2osp_obj(dt);
01425         int                     rc = 0;
01426         struct lu_fid           *fid = &osi->osi_fid;
01427         struct thandle          *local_th;
01428         ENTRY;
01429 
01430         if (is_only_remote_trans(th) &&
01431             !fid_is_zero(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu))) {
01432                 LASSERT(fid_is_sane(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)));
01433 
01434                 rc = osp_md_object_create(env, dt, attr, hint, dof, th);
01435                 if (rc == 0)
01436                         o->opo_non_exist = 0;
01437 
01438                 RETURN(rc);
01439         }
01440 
01441         o->opo_non_exist = 0;
01442         if (o->opo_reserved) {
01443                 /* regular case, fid is assigned holding transaction open */
01444                  osp_object_assign_fid(env, d, o);
01445         }
01446 
01447         memcpy(fid, lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu), sizeof(*fid));
01448 
01449         LASSERTF(fid_is_sane(fid), "fid for osp_object %p is insane"DFID"!\n",
01450                  o, PFID(fid));
01451 
01452         if (!o->opo_reserved) {
01453                 /* special case, id was assigned outside of transaction
01454                  * see comments in osp_declare_attr_set */
01455                 LASSERT(d->opd_pre != NULL);
01456                 spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01457                 osp_update_last_fid(d, fid);
01458                 spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01459         }
01460 
01461         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "fid for osp_object %p is "DFID"\n", o, PFID(fid));
01462 
01463         /* If the precreate ends, it means it will be ready to rollover to
01464          * the new sequence soon, all the creation should be synchronized,
01465          * otherwise during replay, the replay fid will be inconsistent with
01466          * last_used/create fid */
01467         if (osp_precreate_end_seq(env, d) && osp_is_fid_client(d))
01468                 th->th_sync = 1;
01469 
01470         local_th = osp_get_storage_thandle(env, th, d);
01471         if (IS_ERR(local_th))
01472                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(local_th));
01473         /*
01474          * it's OK if the import is inactive by this moment - id was created
01475          * by OST earlier, we just need to maintain it consistently on the disk
01476          * once import is reconnected, OSP will claim this and other objects
01477          * used and OST either keep them, if they exist or recreate
01478          */
01479 
01480         /* we might have lost precreated objects */
01481         if (unlikely(d->opd_gap_count) > 0) {
01482                 LASSERT(d->opd_pre != NULL);
01483                 spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01484                 if (d->opd_gap_count > 0) {
01485                         int count = d->opd_gap_count;
01486 
01487                         ostid_set_id(&osi->osi_oi,
01488                                      fid_oid(&d->opd_gap_start_fid));
01489                         d->opd_gap_count = 0;
01490                         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01491 
01492                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "Writing gap "DFID"+%d in llog\n",
01493                                PFID(&d->opd_gap_start_fid), count);
01494                         /* real gap handling is disabled intil ORI-692 will be
01495                          * fixed, now we only report gaps */
01496                 } else {
01497                         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
01498                 }
01499         }
01500 
01501         /* Only need update last_used oid file, seq file will only be update
01502          * during seq rollover */
01503         osp_objid_buf_prep(&osi->osi_lb, &osi->osi_off,
01504                            &d->opd_last_used_fid.f_oid, d->opd_index);
01505 
01506         rc = dt_record_write(env, d->opd_last_used_oid_file, &osi->osi_lb,
01507                              &osi->osi_off, local_th);
01508 
01509         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: Wrote last used FID: "DFID", index %d: %d\n",
01510                d->opd_obd->obd_name, PFID(fid), d->opd_index, rc);
01511 
01512         RETURN(rc);
01513 }
01514 
01530 int osp_declare_object_destroy(const struct lu_env *env,
01531                                struct dt_object *dt, struct thandle *th)
01532 {
01533         struct osp_object       *o = dt2osp_obj(dt);
01534         struct osp_device       *osp = lu2osp_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
01535         int                      rc = 0;
01536 
01537         ENTRY;
01538 
01539         LASSERT(!osp->opd_connect_mdt);
01540         rc = osp_sync_declare_add(env, o, MDS_UNLINK64_REC, th);
01541 
01542         RETURN(rc);
01543 }
01544 
01562 static int osp_object_destroy(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01563                               struct thandle *th)
01564 {
01565         struct osp_object       *o = dt2osp_obj(dt);
01566         struct osp_device       *osp = lu2osp_dev(dt->do_lu.lo_dev);
01567         int                      rc = 0;
01568 
01569         ENTRY;
01570 
01571         o->opo_non_exist = 1;
01572 
01573         LASSERT(!osp->opd_connect_mdt);
01574         /* once transaction is committed put proper command on
01575          * the queue going to our OST. */
01576         rc = osp_sync_add(env, o, MDS_UNLINK64_REC, th, NULL);
01577         if (rc < 0)
01578                 RETURN(rc);
01579 
01580         /* not needed in cache any more */
01581         set_bit(LU_OBJECT_HEARD_BANSHEE, &dt->do_lu.lo_header->loh_flags);
01582 
01583         RETURN(rc);
01584 }

01591         return -EOPNOTSUPP;

01628 
01639 struct dt_it *osp_it_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
01640                           __u32 attr)
01641 {
01642         struct osp_it *it;
01643 
01644         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(it);
01645         if (it == NULL)
01646                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
01647 
01648         it->ooi_pos_ent = -1;
01649         it->ooi_obj = dt;
01650         it->ooi_attr = attr;
01651 
01652         return (struct dt_it *)it;
01653 }
01654 
01661 void osp_it_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
01662 {
01663         struct osp_it   *it = (struct osp_it *)di;
01664         struct page     **pages = it->ooi_pages;
01665         int             npages = it->ooi_total_npages;
01666         int             i;
01667 
01668         if (pages != NULL) {
01669                 for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
01670                         if (pages[i] != NULL) {
01671                                 if (pages[i] == it->ooi_cur_page) {
01672                                         kunmap(pages[i]);
01673                                         it->ooi_cur_page = NULL;
01674                                 }
01675                                 __free_page(pages[i]);
01676                         }
01677                 }
01678                 OBD_FREE(pages, npages * sizeof(*pages));
01679         }
01680         OBD_FREE_PTR(it);
01681 }
01682 
01695 static int osp_it_fetch(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_it *it)
01696 {
01697         struct lu_device         *dev   = it->ooi_obj->do_lu.lo_dev;
01698         struct osp_device        *osp   = lu2osp_dev(dev);
01699         struct page             **pages;
01700         struct lu_device *top_device;
01701         struct ptlrpc_request    *req   = NULL;
01702         struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc  *desc;
01703         struct idx_info          *ii;
01704         int                       npages;
01705         int                       rc;
01706         int                       i;
01707         ENTRY;
01708 
01709         /* 1MB bulk */
01710         npages = min_t(unsigned int, OFD_MAX_BRW_SIZE, 1 << 20);
01711         npages /= PAGE_CACHE_SIZE;
01712 
01713         OBD_ALLOC(pages, npages * sizeof(*pages));
01714         if (pages == NULL)
01715                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01716 
01717         it->ooi_pages = pages;
01718         it->ooi_total_npages = npages;
01719         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
01720                 pages[i] = alloc_page(GFP_IOFS);
01721                 if (pages[i] == NULL)
01722                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01723         }
01724 
01725         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import,
01726                                    &RQF_OBD_IDX_READ);
01727         if (req == NULL)
01728                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01729 
01730         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OBD_VERSION, OBD_IDX_READ);
01731         if (rc != 0) {
01732                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
01733                 RETURN(rc);
01734         }
01735 
01736         /* Let's allow this request during recovery, otherwise
01737          * if the remote target is also in recovery status,
01738          * it might cause deadlock */
01739         top_device = dev->ld_site->ls_top_dev;
01740         if (top_device->ld_obd->obd_recovering)
01741                 req->rq_allow_replay = 1;
01742 
01743         req->rq_request_portal = OUT_PORTAL;
01744         ii = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_IDX_INFO);
01745         memset(ii, 0, sizeof(*ii));
01746         if (fid_is_last_id(lu_object_fid(&it->ooi_obj->do_lu))) {
01747                 /* LFSCK will iterate orphan object[FID_SEQ_LAYOUT_BTREE,
01748                  * ost_index, 0] with LAST_ID FID, so it needs to replace
01749                  * the FID with orphan FID here */
01750                 ii->ii_fid.f_seq = FID_SEQ_LAYOUT_RBTREE;
01751                 ii->ii_fid.f_oid = osp->opd_index;
01752                 ii->ii_fid.f_ver = 0;
01753                 ii->ii_flags = II_FL_NOHASH;
01754                 ii->ii_attrs = osp_dev2node(osp);
01755         } else {
01756                 ii->ii_fid = *lu_object_fid(&it->ooi_obj->do_lu);
01757                 ii->ii_flags = II_FL_NOHASH | II_FL_NOKEY | II_FL_VARKEY |
01758                                II_FL_VARREC;
01759                 ii->ii_attrs = it->ooi_attr;
01760         }
01761         ii->ii_magic = IDX_INFO_MAGIC;
01762         ii->ii_count = npages * LU_PAGE_COUNT;
01763         ii->ii_hash_start = it->ooi_next;
01764 
01765         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
01766 
01767         desc = ptlrpc_prep_bulk_imp(req, npages, 1,
01768                                     PTLRPC_BULK_PUT_SINK | PTLRPC_BULK_BUF_KIOV,
01769                                     MDS_BULK_PORTAL,
01770                                     &ptlrpc_bulk_kiov_pin_ops);
01771         if (desc == NULL) {
01772                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
01773                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01774         }
01775 
01776         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++)
01777                 desc->bd_frag_ops->add_kiov_frag(desc, pages[i], 0,
01778                                                  PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
01779 
01780         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01781         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01782         if (rc != 0)
01783                 GOTO(out, rc);
01784 
01785         rc = sptlrpc_cli_unwrap_bulk_read(req, req->rq_bulk,
01786                                           req->rq_bulk->bd_nob_transferred);
01787         if (rc < 0)
01788                 GOTO(out, rc);
01789         rc = 0;
01790 
01791         ii = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_IDX_INFO);
01792         if (ii->ii_magic != IDX_INFO_MAGIC)
01793                  GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01794 
01795         npages = (ii->ii_count + LU_PAGE_COUNT - 1) >>
01796                  (PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT - LU_PAGE_SHIFT);
01797         if (npages > it->ooi_total_npages) {
01798                 CERROR("%s: returned more pages than expected, %u > %u\n",
01799                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, npages, it->ooi_total_npages);
01800                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01801         }
01802 
01803         it->ooi_valid_npages = npages;
01804         if (ptlrpc_rep_need_swab(req))
01805                 it->ooi_swab = 1;
01806 
01807         it->ooi_next = ii->ii_hash_end;
01808 
01809 out:
01810         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01811 
01812         return rc;
01813 }
01814 
01833 int osp_it_next_page(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
01834 {
01835         struct osp_it           *it = (struct osp_it *)di;
01836         struct lu_idxpage       *idxpage;
01837         struct page             **pages;
01838         int                     rc;
01839         int                     i;
01840         ENTRY;
01841 
01842 again2:
01843         idxpage = it->ooi_cur_idxpage;
01844         if (idxpage != NULL) {
01845                 if (idxpage->lip_nr == 0)
01846                         RETURN(1);
01847 
01848                 if (it->ooi_pos_ent < idxpage->lip_nr) {
01849                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "ooi_pos %d nr %d\n",
01850                                (int)it->ooi_pos_ent, (int)idxpage->lip_nr);
01851                         RETURN(0);
01852                 }
01853                 it->ooi_cur_idxpage = NULL;
01854                 it->ooi_pos_lu_page++;
01855 
01856 again1:
01857                 if (it->ooi_pos_lu_page < LU_PAGE_COUNT) {
01858                         it->ooi_cur_idxpage = (void *)it->ooi_cur_page +
01859                                          LU_PAGE_SIZE * it->ooi_pos_lu_page;
01860                         if (it->ooi_swab)
01861                                 lustre_swab_lip_header(it->ooi_cur_idxpage);
01862                         if (it->ooi_cur_idxpage->lip_magic != LIP_MAGIC) {
01863                                 struct osp_device *osp =
01864                                         lu2osp_dev(it->ooi_obj->do_lu.lo_dev);
01865 
01866                                 CERROR("%s: invalid magic (%x != %x) for page "
01867                                        "%d/%d while read layout orphan index\n",
01868                                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name,
01869                                        it->ooi_cur_idxpage->lip_magic,
01870                                        LIP_MAGIC, it->ooi_pos_page,
01871                                        it->ooi_pos_lu_page);
01872                                 /* Skip this lu_page next time. */
01873                                 it->ooi_pos_ent = idxpage->lip_nr - 1;
01874                                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01875                         }
01876                         it->ooi_pos_ent = -1;
01877                         goto again2;
01878                 }
01879 
01880                 kunmap(it->ooi_cur_page);
01881                 it->ooi_cur_page = NULL;
01882                 it->ooi_pos_page++;
01883 
01884 again0:
01885                 pages = it->ooi_pages;
01886                 if (it->ooi_pos_page < it->ooi_valid_npages) {
01887                         it->ooi_cur_page = kmap(pages[it->ooi_pos_page]);
01888                         it->ooi_pos_lu_page = 0;
01889                         goto again1;
01890                 }
01891 
01892                 for (i = 0; i < it->ooi_total_npages; i++) {
01893                         if (pages[i] != NULL)
01894                                 __free_page(pages[i]);
01895                 }
01896                 OBD_FREE(pages, it->ooi_total_npages * sizeof(*pages));
01897 
01898                 it->ooi_pos_page = 0;
01899                 it->ooi_total_npages = 0;
01900                 it->ooi_valid_npages = 0;
01901                 it->ooi_swab = 0;
01902                 it->ooi_ent = NULL;
01903                 it->ooi_cur_page = NULL;
01904                 it->ooi_cur_idxpage = NULL;
01905                 it->ooi_pages = NULL;
01906         }
01907 
01908         if (it->ooi_next == II_END_OFF)
01909                 RETURN(1);
01910 
01911         rc = osp_it_fetch(env, it);
01912         if (rc == 0)
01913                 goto again0;
01914 
01915         RETURN(rc);
01916 }
01917 
01932 static int osp_orphan_it_next(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
01933 {
01934         struct osp_it           *it = (struct osp_it *)di;
01935         struct lu_idxpage       *idxpage;
01936         int                     rc;
01937         ENTRY;
01938 
01939 again:
01940         idxpage = it->ooi_cur_idxpage;
01941         if (idxpage != NULL) {
01942                 if (idxpage->lip_nr == 0)
01943                         RETURN(1);
01944 
01945                 it->ooi_pos_ent++;
01946                 if (it->ooi_pos_ent < idxpage->lip_nr) {
01947                         it->ooi_ent =
01948                                 (struct lu_orphan_ent *)idxpage->lip_entries +
01949                                                         it->ooi_pos_ent;
01950                         if (it->ooi_swab)
01951                                 lustre_swab_orphan_ent(it->ooi_ent);
01952                         RETURN(0);
01953                 }
01954         }
01955 
01956         rc = osp_it_next_page(env, di);
01957         if (rc == 0)
01958                 goto again;
01959 
01960         RETURN(rc);
01961 }
01962

01965 {
01966         return 1;
01967 }

01973 static struct dt_key *osp_orphan_it_key(const struct lu_env *env,
01974                                         const struct dt_it *di)
01975 {
01976         struct osp_it   *it  = (struct osp_it *)di;
01977         struct lu_orphan_ent    *ent = (struct lu_orphan_ent *)it->ooi_ent;
01978 
01979         if (likely(ent != NULL))
01980                 return (struct dt_key *)(&ent->loe_key);
01981 
01982         return NULL;
01983 }

01985 static int osp_orphan_it_key_size(const struct lu_env *env,
01986                                   const struct dt_it *di)

01990 
01991 static int osp_orphan_it_rec(const struct lu_env *env, const struct dt_it *di,
01992                              struct dt_rec *rec, __u32 attr)
01993 {
01994         struct osp_it   *it  = (struct osp_it *)di;
01995         struct lu_orphan_ent    *ent = (struct lu_orphan_ent *)it->ooi_ent;
01996 
01997         if (likely(ent != NULL)) {
01998                 *(struct lu_orphan_rec *)rec = ent->loe_rec;
01999                 return 0;
02000         }
02001 
02002         return -EINVAL;
02003 }
02004 
02005 __u64 osp_it_store(const struct lu_env *env, const struct dt_it *di)
02006 {
02007         struct osp_it   *it = (struct osp_it *)di;
02008 
02009         return it->ooi_next;
02010 }
02011 
02024 int osp_orphan_it_load(const struct lu_env *env, const struct dt_it *di,
02025                        __u64 hash)
02026 {
02027         struct osp_it   *it     = (struct osp_it *)di;
02028         int              rc;
02029 
02030         it->ooi_next = hash;
02031         rc = osp_orphan_it_next(env, (struct dt_it *)di);
02032         if (rc == 1)
02033                 return 0;
02034 
02035         if (rc == 0)
02036                 return 1;
02037 
02038         return rc;
02039 }

02042                    void *key_rec)
02043 {
02044         return 0;
02045 }

02047 static const struct dt_index_operations osp_orphan_index_ops = {
02048         .dio_lookup             = osp_orphan_index_lookup,
02049         .dio_declare_insert     = osp_orphan_index_declare_insert,
02050         .dio_insert             = osp_orphan_index_insert,
02051         .dio_declare_delete     = osp_orphan_index_declare_delete,
02052         .dio_delete             = osp_orphan_index_delete,
02053         .dio_it = {
02054                 .init           = osp_it_init,
02055                 .fini           = osp_it_fini,
02056                 .next           = osp_orphan_it_next,
02057                 .get            = osp_it_get,
02058                 .put            = osp_it_put,
02059                 .key            = osp_orphan_it_key,
02060                 .key_size       = osp_orphan_it_key_size,
02061                 .rec            = osp_orphan_it_rec,
02062                 .store          = osp_it_store,
02063                 .load           = osp_orphan_it_load,
02064                 .key_rec        = osp_it_key_rec,
02065         }
02066 };

02083 static int osp_index_try(const struct lu_env *env,
02084                          struct dt_object *dt,
02085                          const struct dt_index_features *feat)
02086 {
02087         const struct lu_fid *fid = lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu);
02088 
02089         if (fid_is_last_id(fid) && fid_is_idif(fid))
02090                 dt->do_index_ops = &osp_orphan_index_ops;
02091         else
02092                 dt->do_index_ops = &osp_md_index_ops;
02093         return 0;
02094 }
02095 
02096 static struct dt_object_operations osp_obj_ops = {
02097         .do_declare_attr_get    = osp_declare_attr_get,
02098         .do_attr_get            = osp_attr_get,
02099         .do_declare_attr_set    = osp_declare_attr_set,
02100         .do_attr_set            = osp_attr_set,
02101         .do_declare_xattr_get   = osp_declare_xattr_get,
02102         .do_xattr_get           = osp_xattr_get,
02103         .do_declare_xattr_set   = osp_declare_xattr_set,
02104         .do_xattr_set           = osp_xattr_set,
02105         .do_declare_create      = osp_declare_object_create,
02106         .do_create              = osp_object_create,
02107         .do_declare_destroy     = osp_declare_object_destroy,
02108         .do_destroy             = osp_object_destroy,
02109         .do_index_try           = osp_index_try,
02110 };
02111 
02127 static int osp_object_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o,
02128                            const struct lu_object_conf *conf)
02129 {
02130         struct osp_object       *po = lu2osp_obj(o);
02131         int                     rc = 0;
02132         ENTRY;
02133 
02134         spin_lock_init(&po->opo_lock);
02135         o->lo_header->loh_attr |= LOHA_REMOTE;
02136 
02137         if (is_ost_obj(o)) {
02138                 po->opo_obj.do_ops = &osp_obj_ops;
02139         } else {
02140                 struct lu_attr *la = &osp_env_info(env)->osi_attr;
02141 
02142                 po->opo_obj.do_ops = &osp_md_obj_ops;
02143                 po->opo_obj.do_body_ops = &osp_md_body_ops;
02144                 if (conf != NULL && conf->loc_flags & LOC_F_NEW) {
02145                         po->opo_non_exist = 1;
02146                 } else {
02147                         rc = po->opo_obj.do_ops->do_attr_get(env, lu2dt_obj(o),
02148                                                              la);
02149                         if (rc == 0)
02150                                 o->lo_header->loh_attr |=
02151                                         LOHA_EXISTS | (la->la_mode & S_IFMT);
02152                         if (rc == -ENOENT) {
02153                                 po->opo_non_exist = 1;
02154                                 rc = 0;
02155                         }
02156                 }
02157                 init_rwsem(&po->opo_sem);
02158         }
02159         RETURN(rc);
02160 }
02161 
02173 static void osp_object_free(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o)
02174 {
02175         struct osp_object       *obj = lu2osp_obj(o);
02176         struct lu_object_header *h = o->lo_header;
02177 
02178         dt_object_fini(&obj->opo_obj);
02179         lu_object_header_fini(h);
02180         if (obj->opo_ooa != NULL) {
02181                 struct osp_xattr_entry *oxe;
02182                 struct osp_xattr_entry *tmp;
02183                 int                     count;
02184 
02185                 list_for_each_entry_safe(oxe, tmp,
02186                                          &obj->opo_ooa->ooa_xattr_list,
02187                                          oxe_list) {
02188                         list_del(&oxe->oxe_list);
02189                         count = atomic_read(&oxe->oxe_ref);
02190                         LASSERTF(count == 1,
02191                                  "Still has %d users on the xattr entry %.*s\n",
02192                                  count-1, (int)oxe->oxe_namelen, oxe->oxe_buf);
02193 
02194                         OBD_FREE(oxe, oxe->oxe_buflen);
02195                 }
02196                 OBD_FREE_PTR(obj->opo_ooa);
02197         }
02198         OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR(obj, osp_object_kmem);
02199 }
02200 
02212 static void osp_object_release(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o)
02213 {
02214         struct osp_object       *po = lu2osp_obj(o);
02215         struct osp_device       *d  = lu2osp_dev(o->lo_dev);
02216 
02217         ENTRY;
02218 
02219         /*
02220          * release reservation if object was declared but not created
02221          * this may require lu_object_put() in LOD
02222          */
02223         if (unlikely(po->opo_reserved)) {
02224                 LASSERT(d->opd_pre != NULL);
02225                 LASSERT(d->opd_pre_reserved > 0);
02226                 spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
02227                 d->opd_pre_reserved--;
02228                 spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
02229 
02230                 /* not needed in cache any more */
02231                 set_bit(LU_OBJECT_HEARD_BANSHEE, &o->lo_header->loh_flags);
02232         }
02233 
02234         if (is_ost_obj(o))
02235                 /* XXX: Currently, NOT cache OST-object on MDT because:
02236                  *      1. it is not often accessed on MDT.
02237                  *      2. avoid up layer (such as LFSCK) to load too many
02238                  *         once-used OST-objects. */
02239                 set_bit(LU_OBJECT_HEARD_BANSHEE, &o->lo_header->loh_flags);
02240 
02241         EXIT;
02242 }
02243 
02244 static int osp_object_print(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie,
02245                             lu_printer_t p, const struct lu_object *l)
02246 {
02247         const struct osp_object *o = lu2osp_obj((struct lu_object *)l);
02248 
02249         return (*p)(env, cookie, LUSTRE_OSP_NAME"-object@%p", o);
02250 }
02251 
02252 static int osp_object_invariant(const struct lu_object *o)
02253 {
02254         LBUG();
02255 }
02256 
02257 struct lu_object_operations osp_lu_obj_ops = {
02258         .loo_object_init        = osp_object_init,
02259         .loo_object_free        = osp_object_free,
02260         .loo_object_release     = osp_object_release,
02261         .loo_object_print       = osp_object_print,
02262         .loo_object_invariant   = osp_object_invariant
02263 };
